Live Blog | UK-Boston basketball updates

The Cats tip off at 7 p.m. Friday.

Calipari says Cats need early test vs. Kansas

No. 1 UK holds off Buffalo upset bid 71-52

Live Blog | UK-Boston basketball updates

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 8:56 p.m. EST November 21, 2014
Buy Photo

Kentucky guard Dominique Hawkins, left, fights for a loose ball with Boston University guard Cedric Hankerson in the first half. The University of Kentucky Men's Basketball team hosted Boston University, Friday, Nov. 21, 2014 at Rupp Arena in Lexington. Photo by Jonathan Palmer, Special to the CJ(Photo: Jonathan Palmer, Special to The Courier-Journal)Buy Photo

1 CONNECT 10 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh this page regularly (or click here) for updates before, during and after the University of Kentucky's 7 p.m. Friday basketball game against Boston University at Rupp Arena.

6:42, 2H: Ballgame? Devin Booker hit a deep 3-pointer and then a baseline jumper. To cap a 9-0 run, UK forced a Boston turnover, and Aaron Harrison threw down a dunk at the other end. It's 75-57.

7:44, 2H: Devin Booker fell into the cheerleaders along the baseline, saving a ball inbounds to a wide-open Willie Cauley-Stein under the basket. His layup has UK back ahead double digits at the under-eight timeout, 68-57.

8:26, 2H: Cedric Hankerson. Again. Another 3-pointer of his hung the net and pulled Boston to within 66-57 of No. 1 UK. Hankerson now has 23 points and has hit 7 of 14 shots.

9:09, 2H: Boston star Cedreic Hankerson, fouled on a 3-pointer, hit two of his free throws to make it 66-54 UK. Hankerson has a game-high 20 points. Aaron Harrison has a team-high 14 points for UK, while Devin Booker and Willie Cauley-Stein are in double figures with 10 apiece.

Devin Booker has career highs in points (10) and assists (five) tonight. UK has hit its last four field goals and leads 66-54 with 9:09 left

— Kentucky Basketball (@KentuckyMBB) November 22, 2014

10:00, 2H: Back to back Devin Booker lobs to Trey Lyles for alley-oop dunks have given UK some serious breathing room and produced the Cats' largest lead at 63-50.

11:26, 2H: UK's lead is 11 at the under-12 timeout, thanks to a 3-pointer by freshman Devin Booker. Fouls are catching up to Boston -- two players have four and two others three -- though the Terriers' Cedric Hankerson did draw one of his own into the break. That whistle got Boston into the bonus. UK's in the double bonus.

Booker splashes a 3-pointer for Kentucky's largest lead over BU, 59-48 with 11:26 to play.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) November 22, 2014

12:12, 2H: Two Aaron Harrison free throws have the lead back out to 10, at 56-46.

13:00, 2H: When the score tightens late, the platoons loosen up. Now on the court for UK: Aaron Harrison, Andrew Harrison, Tyler Ulis, Willie Cauley-Stein and Dakari Johnson.

13:52, 2H: And for the rest of this one, UK will shoot in the double bonus. It's 51-44.

14:15, 2H: It's getting chippy now. Karl-Anthony Towns' elbow met Nathan Dieudonne's face. Officials ruled it a common foul, but Dieudonne appeared in some pain. After a clean first half, the whistles are piling up.

14:34, 2H: Welcome home, Nathan Dieudonne. As the Trinity High School grad was walking to the free throw line, he kept talking, and officials whistled him for a technical foul -- Boston's second of the night. Aaron Harrison hit 1 of 2 free throws to increase UK's lead to 48-44, and Karl-Anthony Towns hit another two to make it 50-44.

15:30, 2H: With this game close, John Calipari is tring a new linup: Devin Booker, Aaron Harriston, Andrew Harrison, Willie Cauley-Stein and Karl-Anthony Towns.

15:53, 2H: UK's in a battle, up two on Patriot League member Boston into the under-16 timeout. Both teams are shooting red-hot in the second half -- the Cats 3 of 5 and the Terriers 4 of 6.

Aaron Harrison is in to double digits for the first time this season. Cauley-Stein and Lyles both have three fouls.

— Kentucky Basketball (@KentuckyMBB) November 22, 2014

16:00, 2H: The Rupp Arena crowd is getting into it, and for the wrong reason. Boston's Cedric Hankerson is on fire, having hit back-to-back buckets that pull the Terriers to within 46-44. Hankerson, who has 14 points, just picked up a technical foul for something the sophomore guard said. Aaron Harrison was also assigned a technical foul.

It was the first foul of the game for Harrison and second for Hankerson.

18:57, 2H: Boston scored back-to-back buckets, forcing the second while pressing, forcing a quick UK timeout and imminent platoon switch with the score now 42-39.

20:00, 2H: Earlier, it was mentioned that Trey Lyles' block or Aaron Harrison's reverse layup could go as play of the game. Then UK let the mascot shoot. The Wildcat hit a half-courter during the break, winning free textbooks for a semester for student Alexis Winston.

By the way, the Cats' second platoon -- Tyler Ulis, Devin Booker, Trey Lyles, Marcus Lee and Dakari Johnson -- are out to open the second half.

Halftime: Funny how basketball works. Three days after limiting Kansas to 40 points in a game, the Cats gave up 35 to Boston in the first half and carry just a 5-point lead into the locker room.

The Terriers' Eric Fanning hit a contested 3-pointer on Boston's final possession to set the margin.

For the half, UK shot 17 of 30 (57 percent) and was led in scoring with Andrew Harrison's 9 points. Willie Cauley-Stein added 8.

Kentucky stats as the Cats lead Boston 40-35 at the half: http://t.co/i5UdFRRZ5Lpic.twitter.com/Qgm0YHAT2M

— Jonathan Lintner (@JonathanLintner) November 22, 2014

2:39, 1H: Back-to-back turnovers by the starting platoon means the second group is back in to finish the half. The lead is 33-26. UK already has more turnovers (eight) against Boston than in its win over Kansas (six).

3:43, 1H: Boston appeared poised to make another run and pull even with UK again, but the Cats punched back this time. Aaron Harrison made a stunning reverse layup, and Willie Cauley-Stein caught an alley-oop pass from Andrew Harrison to move UK ahead 33-23 at the under-four timeout. The Cats are dominating in the paint with a 22-6 advantage.

6:17, 1H: Highlight of the night so far: Trey Lyles volleyball-style spiked Boston's Cheddi Mosley. But John Calipari is done with his White (second) platoon for now. The Cats committed their sixth turnover, and John Calipari put the Blue back in out of a timeout.

7:31, 1H: The Cats carry a 10-0 run (and their first double-digit lead of the night at 26-16) into the under-8 timeout. They've shot 12 of 22 from the field with a game-high seven points from point guard Andrew Harrison. Going into the timeout, Dominique Hawkins picked up his second foul on a hand check.

The Cats are plus-13 with Dominique Hawkins on the floor tonight.

— Kentucky Basketball (@KentuckyMBB) November 22, 2014

8:52, 1H: UK roared back from Boston's run with eight straight points of its own, six of them via dunks in transition and all in 67 seconds. Terriers timeout, part two.

10:44, 1H: It's tied 16-16 on a 9-0 Boston run that's contained multiple easy dunks, including the one that knotted the score by Justin Alston.

11:37, 1H: In with the starting unit this time is Derek Willis, off the bench in place of Dominique Hawkins.

11:54, 1H: Out of its timeout, Boston scored on a dunk of its own by 2012 Kentucky Mr. Basketball Nathan Dieudonne, and the next trip up the court his a 3-pointer. It's 16-12 into the under-12 timeout, and UK's starting platoon is back on the floor. The Cats have hit 7 of 13 shots and have nine of their points off turnovers.

Must cut across the lane to ball side.

— Jon Hood (@jonnylightning4) November 22, 2014

High post is wide open.

— Jon Hood (@jonnylightning4) November 22, 2014

13:06, 1H: Timeout, Boston. UK scored on consecutive dunks in a matter of seconds, first on a Devin Booker pass to Trey Lyles and later on a fast break off the Cats' press. Dakari Johnson ran the floor, got an offensive rebound and jammed.

14:17, 1H: On one end, a Boston 3-pointer. On the other, Tyler Ulis missed his post man and committed a turnover. The Terriers aren't folding yet, trailing 12-7 now.

15:54, 1H: The second platoon checked in, and Devin Booker shook off Tuesday's shooting slump by making his first attempt from beyond the arc. It followed up on an Aaron Harrison 3-pointer that has UK ahead 10-4 early. The Cats are 4 of 6 from the field.

17:49, 1H: With the score knotted at 2-2, John Calipari sent his backups to the scorers table at the 17:49 mark, before Willie Cauley-Stein got a basket and foul in transition. Calipari then sent the second platoon back to the bench, obviously happy to let the first keep playing until the under-16 timeout.

See all the tweets about bad camera angles by Fox; can tell you main game cams are in the same spot. Maybe just zoomed out too much...

— Big Blue Insider (@bigblueinsider1) November 22, 2014

18:46, 1H: UK and Boston traded buckets to open before Dominique Hawkins, in his first start of the season, came up with a quick hustle play, forcing an early jump ball on the Terriers' side of the court.

20:00, 1H: In his pregame speech, John Calipari asked his players to "validate" Tuesday's win over Kansas. In other words, look just as impressive against Boston.

Mentioned earlier, Mike Jarvis is on the call tonight. He coached three different teams that visited Rupp Arena and called it "one of the most fabulous places to play."

PREGAME: Late-breaking news before tipoff of UK-Boston: Starting Cats forward Alex Poythress is out with an illness and is "day to day." Platooning in his place -- and this keeps both the "Blue" and "White" units in tact -- will be Dominique Hawkins.

Other than, that, UK's back in full force three days after beating top-five foe Kansas by 32 points.

Alex Poythress' streak of 76 straight games played will be snapped tonight with his absence.

— Kentucky Basketball (@KentuckyMBB) November 21, 2014

--For preview information, check out a game advance (http://cjky.it/1v4Pech), full pregame Q&A with assistant John Robic (http://cjky.it/11Eg3bg) and look at a fan vote that insists the Cats would top the NBA's Philadelphia 76ers (http://cjky.it/1qK4w6y).

--On the FSN call with Dave Baker Friday night will be Mike Jarvis, a well-spoken former Boston coach who led the Terriers to a pair of NCAA tournament appearances.

--One other story line to watch? On Boston's roster is a former Kentucky Mr. Basketball, Trinity High School graduate Nathan Dieudonne, who last played in Rupp Arena while helping the Shamrocks to the 2012 state championship.

UK Platoon No. 1

G Andrew Harrison

G Aaron Harrison

F Dominique Hawkins

F Willie Cauley-Stein

F Karl-Anthony Towns

UK Platoon No. 2

G Tyler Ulis

G Devin Booker

F Trey Lyles

F Marcus Lee

C Dakari Johnson

Probable Boston starters

G John Papale

G Cheddi Mosley

G Cedric Hankerson

F Nathan Dieudonne

F Justin Alston
